alert.note: Alert for Daviess (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 5:28PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Daviess County through 515 PM CDT... At 428 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Masonville, or near Owensboro. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Owensboro. This includes the following highways... Interstate 165 between Mile Markers 63 and 70. Audubon Parkway between Mile Markers 20 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
